channel.title: Importing and Exporting
channel.description: Updated Importing and Exporting content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Information from the Border Center about Requirements for Importers and Exporters of Vehicles, Engines and Fuels
item.description:
The Border Center Exit, developed with support from U.S. EPA, provides information to help you better understand and comply with environmental laws regulating the import and export of environmentally sensitive products, materials and wastes into and from the United States.
 
Below are links from The Border Center related to Import and Export of Vehicles, Engines, and Fuels.
 
  • Automotive Refinish Coatings Exit
  • Fuel, Fuel Additives Exit
  • Portable Fuel Containers Exit
  • Small Non-Road Engines Exit
  • Importing Mini-Trucks Exit
item.dc:creator: emarzouk

item.title: Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program Requirements for Importers and Exporters
item.description:
The EPA Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program (GHGRP) requires annual reporting of greenhouse gas (GHG) data and other relevant information from large sources and suppliers in the United States. The regulation referred to as 40 CFR Part 98, which was published in the Federal Register on October 9, 2009, covers:

  • Suppliers of certain products that would result in GHG emissions if released, combusted or oxidized;
  • direct emitting source categories; and
  • facilities that inject CO2 underground for geologic sequestration or any purpose other than geologic sequestration.

Specifically, the regulation includes importers/exporters of:

  • Coal based liquid fuels (subpart LL), 
  • Petroleum products (subpart MM), 
  • Industrial gases (subpart OO), 
  • Carbon dioxide (subpart PP), and 
  • Fluorinated GHGs contained in pre-charged equipment or closed-cell foams (subpart QQ).

Requirements for each of these types of importers/exporters are detailed below. Importers and exporters that meet the threshold as defined below and that are required to report under one of the following subparts should visit the GHG Reporting Program website to review the applicable requirements. A help desk is also available.

Suppliers of Coal-based Liquids Fuels (Subpart LL) 

  • Importers who bring coal-based petroleum products or natural gas liquids (NGLs) into the United States from a foreign country must report if the quantity of coal-based petroleum products imported is equivalent to 25,000 metric tons of CO2e or more.
  • Exporters who transfer coal-based petroleum products or NGLs from the United States to another country or to an affiliate in another country must report if the quantity of coal-based petroleum products exported is equivalent to 25,000 metric tons of CO2e or more.
Learn more about reporting requirements for Suppliers of Coal-based Liquids Fuels
 

Suppliers of Petroleum Products (Subpart MM) 

  • Importers who bring petroleum products or natural gas liquids (NGLs) into the United States from a foreign country, including any blender or refiner of refined or semi-refined petroleum products, must report if the quantity of petroleum products imported is equivalent to 25,000 metric tons of CO2e or more.
  • Exporters who transfer petroleum products or NGLs from the United States to another country or to an affiliate in another country, including any blender or refiner of refined or semi-refined  petroleum products, must report if the quantity of petroleum products imported is equivalent to 25,000 metric tons of CO2e or more.
Learn more about reporting requirements for Suppliers of Petroleum Products
 

Suppliers of Industrial Greenhouse Gases (Subpart OO) 

Bulk importers or exporters of fluorinated GHGs or N2O have to report if either their total imports or their total exports of fluorinated GHGs is greater than or equal to 25,000 metric tons of CO2e per year.
 
Learn more about reporting requirements for Suppliers of Industrial Greenhouse Gases
 

Suppliers of Carbon Dioxide (Subpart PP) 

  • Importers of bulk CO2, if total combined imports of CO2 and other GHGs exceed 25,000 tons of CO2e per year. 
  • Exporters of bulk CO2, if total combined exports of CO2 and other GHGs exceed 25,000 tons of CO2e per year. 
Learn more about reporting requirements for Suppliers of Carbon Dioxide
 

Imports and Exports of Equipment Pre-charged with Fluorinated GHGs or Containing Fluorinated GHGs in Closed-cell Foams (Subpart QQ)

Importers and exporters of pre-charged equipment and closed-cell foams that contain fluorinated GHGs have to report if either their total imports or their total exports of fluorinated GHGs in equipment and foams is greater than or equal to 25,000 metric tons of CO2e per year.
 
Learn more about reporting requirements for Imports and Exports of Equipment Pre-charged with Fluorinated GHGs or Containing Fluorinated GHGs in Closed-cell Foams
item.dc:creator: emarzouk

item.title: Contact Us about EPA Requirements for Importers and Exporters
item.description:
To get the quickest response:

  • If you have a general question about importing and exporting, browse EPA Requirements for Importers and Exporters to find your topic of interest.
  • Can't find it on the above page?  Check out The Border Center Exit, which explores regulations, agreements, programs and news relating to the import and export of environmentally sensitive materials, focusing specifically on import/export in North America.  The site includes vehicles, engines, wastes, chemicals, and consumer products.
  • Looking for information about importing a vehicle or engine?  Browse Importing Vehicles and Engines or Contact Us about Importing Vehicles and Engines.
  • Looking for information about importing or exporting chemicals?  Learn about import and export requirements under the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA) or Contact Us about TSCA Import-Export Requirements. 
  • Questions related to Insecticides, Fungicides, and Rodenticides?  Browse Pesticide Imports and Exports.
  • Questions about Ozone Depleting Substances?  Contact the Stratospheric Protection Division.
  • Seeking information about hazardous waste?  Visit Import/Export Requirements for Hazardous Waste or The Border Center.Exit

Don't see the topic of your question? You can submit a question using the form below.  Be sure to include your e-mail address if you’d like a response.  Note that while we strive to respond to every question submitted with an answer or an appropriate referral as quickly as possible, responses can take some time. 

Mailing Address:

Report a Violation

Report possible violations of environmental laws and regulations.

Environmental Protection Agency
1200 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W.
Mail Code 2660R
Washington, DC 20460
